intro: Protium macrocarpum, commonly known as the large-fruited sycamore, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and large, elliptical leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits that contain a single large seed. Its botanical features make it valuable for both ecological and commercial purposes. The tree is also noted for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and climatic conditions.
